title: Aaron Hernandez's double-murder trial delayed by Boston snowstorm
text:
NFL February 12, 2017 6:04pm EST February 12, 2017 6:00pm EST American Football, News, English, Aaron Hernandez, NFL, New England Patriots The former Patriots star will soon stand trial for the 2012 fatal drive-by shootings of two men outside a Boston nightclub. Aaron Hernandez (Getty Images) 
Updated at 6:04 p.m. ET 
Updated at 6:04 p.m. ET 
Severe winter weather will push back jury selection in the double-homicide trial of former Patriots star Aaron Hernandez, which was set to begin Monday. 
With the Boston metro area bracing for as much as 12 inches of snowfall by Monday afternoon, jury selection in the trial will likely be delayed until Thursday, a spokesman for the Suffolk County District Attorneyâ€™s office announced. 
MORE: 40 most hated NFL players of all time: loudmouths, cheaters, criminals 
Hernandez, serving a life sentence for the 2013 murder of Odin L. Lloyd, is set to stand trial in the 2012 fatal drive-by shootings of two men outside a Boston nightclub. 
Prosecutors allege Hernandez shot and killed Safiro Furtado and Daniel de Abreu on July 16, 2012, over a fight that started when one of the men spilled a drink on Hernandez inside the nightclub. Alexander Bradley, a former friend who was with Hernandez in the vehicle, is scheduled to testify in the trial. 
Hernandez is facing a separate charge of witness intimidation for allegedly shooting Bradley in Florida in 2013. 
The 27-year-old former NFL tight end has pleaded not guilty to the homicide charges. Watch This
